diseasystore 0.1

    diseasystore: Google Health COVID-19 Open Data Quick start
  • Changelog

    Opens connection to the database

    mg_reexports.Rd

    Connects to the specified dbname of host:port using user and password from given arguments. Certain drivers may use credentials stored in a file, such as ~/.pgpass (PostgreSQL)

    Overloads the dplyr _join to accept an na_by argument. By default, joining using SQL does not match on NA / NULL. dbplyr has the option "na_matches = na" to match on NA / NULL but this is very inefficient This function does the matching more efficiently. If a column contains NA / NULL, give the argument to na_by to match during the join If no na_by is given, the function defaults to using dplyr::_join

    The function "interlaces" the queries and combines their validity time axes onto a single time axis

    If filter = NULL, not filtering is done If filter is different from NULL, the .data is filtered by a mg_inner_join using all columns of the filter: mg_inner_join(.data, filter, by = colnames(filter))

    by and na_by can overwrite the mg_inner_join columns used in the filtering

    Create an object for logging database operations

    Usage

    mg_get_connection(
  drv = RPostgres::Postgres(),
  host = NULL,
  port = NULL,
  dbname = NULL,
  user = NULL,
  password = NULL,
  timezone = NULL,
  timezone_out = NULL,
  ...
)

mg_get_tables(conn, pattern = NULL)

mg_get_table(
  conn,
  db_table_id = NULL,
  slice_ts = NA,
  include_slice_info = FALSE
)

mg_table_exists(conn, db_table_id)

mg_id(db_table_id, conn = NULL)

mg_slice_time(.data, slice_ts, from_ts = from_ts, until_ts = until_ts)

mg_inner_join(x, y, by = NULL, na_by = NULL, ...)

mg_left_join(x, y, by = NULL, na_by = NULL, ...)

mg_mg_right_join(x, y, sql_on, renamer, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_dbi
mg_mg_right_join(x, y, sql_on, renamer, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_SQLiteConnection

mg_select_na_sql(x, y, by, na_by, left = TRUE)

mg_digest_to_checksum_native_md5(.data, col)

  .data,
  conn,
  db_table,
  timestamp,
  filters = NULL,
  message = NULL,
  tic = Sys.time(),
  log_path = getOption("mg.log_path"),
  log_table_id = getOption("mg.log_table_id"),
  enforce_chronological_order = TRUE
)

mg_is.historical(.data)

mg_nrow(.data)

mg_age_labels(age_cuts)

mg_assert_dbtable_like(db_table, ..., add = NULL)

mg_assert_timestamp_like(timestamp, ..., add = NULL)

mg_assert_data_like(.data, ..., add = NULL)

mg_assert_id_like(mg_id, ..., add = NULL)

    Arguments

    drv

    An object that inherits from DBIDriver or an existing DBIConnection (default: RPostgres::Postgres())

    host

    Character string giving the ip of the host to connect to

    port

    Host port to connect to (numeric)

    dbname

    Name of the database located at the host

    user

    Username to login with

    password

    Password to login with

    timezone

    Sets the timezone of DBI::dbConnect()

    timezone_out

    Sets the timezone_out of DBI::dbConnect()

    ...

    Parameters passed to checkmate::check_*

    conn

    An object that inherits from DBIConnection (as generated by get_connection())'

    pattern

    A regex pattern with which to subset the returned tables

    db_table_id

    A DBI::Id() object or a character string readable by mg_id.

    slice_ts

    The time / date to slice by

    include_slice_info

    Default FALSE. If set TRUE, the history columns "checksum", "from_ts", "until_ts" are returned also

    .data

    Object to test if is data.table, data.frame, tbl or tibble

    from_ts

    The name of the column in .data specifying valid from time (note: must be unquoted)

    until_ts

    The name of the column in .data specifying valid until time (note: must be unquoted)

    x, y

    A pair of lazy data frames backed by database queries.

    by

    passed to mg_inner_join if different from NULL

    na_by

    passed to mg_inner_join if different from NULL

    sql_on

    A custom join predicate as an SQL expression. Usually joins use column equality, but you can perform more complex queries by supply sql_on which should be a SQL expression that uses LHS and RHS aliases to refer to the left-hand side or right-hand side of the join respectively.

    renamer

    named list generated by mg_select_na_sql

    left

    Boolean that control if joins is left (alternatively right) join

    tables

    A list(!) of tables you want to combine is supplied here as lazy_queries.

    colnames

    If the time axes of validity is not called "valid_to" and "valid_until" inside each lazy_query, you can specify their names by supplying the arguments as a list (e.g. c(t1.from = "\<colname\>", t2.until = "\<colname\>"). colnames must be named in same order as as given in tables (i.e. t1, t2, t3, ...).

    col

    The name of column the checksums will be placed in

    exclude

    Columns to exclude from the checksum generation

    warn

    Flag to warn if target column already exists in data

    data

    A data frame.

    sep

    Separator to use between values.

    remove

    If TRUE, remove input columns from output data frame.

    na.rm

    If TRUE, missing values will be removed prior to uniting each value.

    temporary

    Should the table be created as a temporary table?

    db_table

    Object to test if is of class "tbl_dbi" or character on form "schema.table"

    timestamp

    Object to test if is POSIX or character

    filters

    A filter to subset data by. if filters == NULL, no filtering occurs. Else, an mg_inner_join is performed using all columns of the filter

    message

    A message to add to the log-file (useful for supplying metadata to the log)

    tic

    A timestamp when computation began. If not supplied, it will be created at call-time. (Used to more accurately convey how long runtime of the update process has been)

    log_path

    The path where logs are stored. If NULL, no file logs are created.

    log_table_id

    A DBI::Id() object or a character string readable by mg_id, specifying the location of the log table.

    enforce_chronological_order

    A logical that controls whether or not to check if timestamp of update is prior to timestamps in the DB

    log_table

    A specification of where the logs should exist ("schema.table")

    age_cuts

    The lower bound of the groups (0 is implicitly included)

    add

    AssertCollection to add assertions to

    mg_id

    Object to test if is of class "Id" or character on form "schema.table"

    Value

    An object that inherits from DBIConnection driver specified in drv

    A data.frame containing table names in the DB

    A "lazy" dataframe (tbl_lazy) generated using dbplyr

    An object similar to .data

         The combination of input queries with a single, interlaced
             valid_from / valid_until time axis

    Invisibly returns the table as it looks on the destination (or locally if conn is NULL)

    An object similar to .data

    TRUE if .data contains the columns: "checksum", "from_ts", and "until_ts". FALSE otherwise

    The number of records in the object

    A vector of labels with zero-padded numerics so they can be sorted easily

    Details

    This function generates a much faster sql statement for NA join compared to dbplyr's _join with na_matches = "na".

    See also

    DBI::Id which this function wraps.

    dplyr::mutate-joins which this function wraps.

    dbplyr::join.tbl_sql which this function wraps.

    mg_filter_keys

    Public fields

    log_path

    (character(1))
    A directory where log file is written (if this is not NULL). Defaults to getOption("mg.log_path").

    log_filename

    (character(1))
    The name (basename) of the log file.

    log_tbl

    The DB table used for logging. Class is connection-specific, but inherits from tbl_dbi.

    start_time

    (POSIXct(1))
    The time at which data processing was started.

    Methods

    Public methods

    • mg_Logger$new()

    • mg_Logger$log_info()

    • mg_Logger$log_warn()

    • mg_Logger$log_error()

    • mg_Logger$log_to_db()

    • mg_Logger$clone()

    Method new()

    Create a new mg_Logger object

    Usage

    mg_Logger$new(
  db_tablestring = NULL,
  log_table_id = getOption("mg.log_table_id"),
  log_conn = NULL,
  log_path = getOption("mg.log_path"),
  ts = NULL,
  start_time = Sys.time()
)

    Arguments

    db_tablestring

    A string specifying the table being updated

    log_table_id

    A DBI::Id() object or a character string readable by mg_id, specifying the location of the log table.

    log_conn

    A database connection inheriting from DBIConnection

    log_path

    The path where logs are stored. If NULL, no file logs are created.

    ts

    A timestamp describing the data being processed (≠ current time)

    start_time

    The time at which data processing was started (defaults to Sys.time())

    Method log_info()

    Write a line to log file

    Usage

    mg_Logger$log_info(..., tic = Sys.time(), log_type = "INFO")

    Arguments

    ...

    One or more character strings to be concatenated

    tic

    The timestamp used by the log entry (default Sys.time())

    log_type

    A character string which describes the severity of the log message

    Method log_warn()

    Write a warning to log file and generate warning.

    Usage

    mg_Logger$log_warn(..., log_type = "WARNING")

    Arguments

    ...

    One or more character strings to be concatenated

    log_type

    A character string which describes the severity of the log message

    Method log_error()

    Write an error to log file and stop execution

    Usage

    mg_Logger$log_error(..., log_type = "ERROR")

    Arguments

    ...

    One or more character strings to be concatenated

    log_type

    A character string which describes the severity of the log message

    Method log_to_db()

    Write or update log table

    Usage

    mg_Logger$log_to_db(...)

    Arguments

    ...

    Name-value pairs with which to update the log table

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    mg_Logger$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
